Legal_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge's decision was reasonable and adequately explained given discrepancies in evidence
Application_Facts: Applicant Hye Young Lee required to prove 1,095 days of physical presence in Canada over four years; had missing re-entry stamps and incomplete documentation
Decision_Outcome: Citizenship judge approved application; court dismissed Minister's judicial review
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of citizenship judge's decision
Court_Ruling: Decision upheld; citizenship judge's reasoning found reasonable
Defendant_Behavior: Provided explanations for travel documentation gaps; submitted affidavit evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Insufficient evidence of residency as per statutory requirements
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of applicant's travel history, completeness of documentation
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review process assessing adequacy of reasoning and legal compliance
Credibility_Assessment: Citizenship judge found respondent's travel history credible despite evidentiary gaps
Evidence_Used: Affidavit evidence, travel records, hearing testimony
Legal_Provision_Cited: Physical presence requirement of 1,095 days under Citizenship Act
Application_Basis: Naturalization through fulfillment of residency obligation
Evidence_Assessed: Missing re-entry stamps, incomplete documentation, supplemental affidavits
Relief_Sought: Overturn of citizenship approval due to alleged non-compliance
Governing_Rule: Applicants must demonstrate physical presence in Canada for 1,095 days within four years
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of complete entry/exit stamps and supporting documents
Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed; original decision upheld
Harm_Assessment: No harm established; decision deemed reasonable
Cause_Description: Minister challenged approval due to insufficient proof of residency duration
Evidence_Handling: Gaps acknowledged but explained; additional affidavits accepted to fill record
Legal_Provision_Violated: Failure to meet 1,095-day physical presence requirement (alleged)
Evidence_Issues: Discrepancies in travel documentation, lack of official border records
Residency_Compliance: Judge concluded compliance based on credible explanation and supplementary evidence
Legal_Provision: Section of Citizenship Act regarding physical presence for naturalization
Evidence_Assessment: Judge assessed credibility and plausibility of travel history despite incomplete records
Decision_Rationale: Decision was internally coherent, justified, and fell within range of reasonable outcomes
Country_of_Origin: South Korea (inferred from name Hye Young Lee, not explicitly stated)
Decision_Making_Body: Citizenship Commission (via citizenship judge), reviewed by Federal Court
Evidentiary_Issues: Incomplete government records, reliance on self-reported travel history
